intro: Calycolpus angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calycolpus, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. Calycolpus angustifolius is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral morphology and ecological adaptations.
